STAFF ACCOUNTANT
Professional Profile
To advance in professional and personal experiences within Finance, Tax Accounting and Management To obtain a Staff Accountant position that will enable me to perform my best using my mathematical, numerical, accounting and analytical ability for the betterment of the organization.
Highly proactive professional with 10+ years of experience in accounting and economics.
Eager to achieve highest standard of accounting operations and greatest quality of work.
Outstanding communication (written and spoken), drafting and computer skills.
Strong critical thinking skills.
High Proficiency in all computer applications.
Remarkable skill at organizing work and resolving problems that arise in day to day activities.
In-depth ability to work with difficult clientele in a respectful and courteous manner.
Observant, intuitive and conscientious with great attention to detail.
Deep ability to develop and institute processes and procedures.
Qualifications
Microsoft applications Excellent writing skills Research support Analytical skills
Independent worker Time management Attention to detail
Relevant Experience
Accounting Skills
Operated computers programmed with accounting software to record, store, and analyze information.
Research
Investigated and analyzed client complaints to identify and resolve issues.
Reporting
Maintained status reports to provide management with updated information for client projects.

TRAINING

Successfully trained staff in all office systems and databases, policies and procedures while focusing on minimizing errors and generating superior results.

Create/execute notice of value (NOV) variance reporting through established parameters in PTMS Follow through on acquiring necessary refund(s) for erroneous fund dispersals on tax debts Obtain and assess Assessor Property Record Cards (PRC's) to identify land values on properties exceeding established thresholds Monitor Appeals and Hearing deadlines tracking for compliance.

Perform weekly withdrawal calculations to determine account refund or deficit status Provide associate assistance, support, and advice where applicable Prepare and file monthly Sales & Use Tax online.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Staff Accountant

Location: Austin, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
We are looking for an energetic Staff Accountant looking to obtain accelerated learning and

experience in a fast-paced, high growth environment. Our health insurance organization is seeking an entry level Staff Accountant. The successful applicant will work on accounts payable, accounts receivable and other general accounting and reconciliation tasks. A number of tasks requiring data analysis, in-depth evaluation, and exercising judgment within

the appropriate scope of practice. We offer excellent benefits, generous paid time off and a competitive salary. You must be a highly organized professional with a great eye for detail. You must be reliable, able to carry out tasks autonomously and be able to work collaboratively as needed. The goal is to keep the accounts payable and financial processes of the company up to standard and ensure accurate financial reporting and control.

This is a full-time on-site role. You will report to the Accounting Manager.

Job Responsibilities

Handle accounts payable for multiple related entities and vendors, properly coding for accurate financial statements. All facets of vendor relations from facilitating setup, entering invoices, managing vendor inquiries and communication. Ensuring proper internal control and support, including supporting other company departments as it relates to payables. Reconciling processed work by verifying entries and comparing system reports to balancesRecording of month end accruals, and other accounts payable related journal entries. Maintaining historical recordsPreparing analyses of accounts and producing monthly reportsContinuing to improve the accuracy and payment process. Support improvements to financial processes and procedures. Assisting with audits as neededHandle workload in a timely and accurate mannerSpecial projects as required. Additional responsibilities as required. 

Qualifications/Skills

Bachelorâ€™s degree in finance, accounting, economics, business administration or related field required (3.0 GPA or greater)Prior experience with NetSuite ERP System is a plus. Attention to detail. Ability to and willingness to learn. Efficient communication and ability to work in a team environment. Proficient in MS ExcelAuthorized to work in the US

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
